meals.name: Beef & Broccoli
meals.description: Beef and broccoli is a classic Chinese-American dish. The sauce calls for garlic, broth, soy sauce, lime juice, and Srirachaâ€”ingredients.
ingredients: 1 lb. sirloin steak, sliced thinly against grain
minced 1/3 c. low-sodium beef (or chicken) broth

directions.step-1: In a medium bowl, whisk 1/3 cup soy sauce, lime juice, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, and 1 tablespoon cornstarch until combined. Add steak, season with salt and pepper, and toss until steak is coated. Marinate 20 minutes.
directions.step-2: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add steak in a single layer, working in batches if needed, and cook until seared, about 2 minutes per side. Remove steak and set aside.
directions.step-3: Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon cornstarch until garlic is coated, then stir in broth, remaining 2 tablespoons brown sugar, remaining 1/3 cup soy sauce, and Sriracha. Bring mixture to a simmer. Add broccoli and simmer until tender, about 5 minutes. Season sauce with salt and pepper (if necessary), then return steak to skillet.
directions.step-4: Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions before serving.

meals.name: Wonton Soup
meals.description: We turn to this quick and easy wonton soup over and over when temperatures start dropping. Not only does it come together in a flash, it's also super satisfying without weighing you down.

for the soup: 2 tbsp. Sliced green onions, for garnish

directions.step-1: In a large bowl, mix pork, soy sauce, chives, vinegar, cornstarch, ginger, garlic, red pepper flakes and sesame oil until fully incorporated
directions.step-2: Using your finger, wet the edges of wonton wrapper with water. Place half a tablespoon of pork filling in the center of the wonton wrapper. Fold wonton in half diagonally to create a triangle, and seal the edges. Fold the two identical corners in on each other and press again to seal. Repeat until all wonton wrappers are filled.
directions.step-3: Bring all soup ingredients to a boil. Simmer on low for 10 minutes, then remove ginger and garlic cloves and bring it back to a boil. Lower in wontons and cook for 10 minutes more. Serve into bowls and garnish with green onions.
